text: Jon Voight (born December 29, 1938) is an American actor. Voight came to publicity in the late 1960s with his Academy Awardâ€“nominated performance as Joe Buck, a would-be gigolo, in Midnight Cowboy (1969). He has received an Academy Award for Best Actor, having received it for his role in the 1978 film Coming Home, in which he played a paraplegic Vietnam War veteran. In the 1970s, he became renowned as a Hollywood star. Voight is a Republican who supports anti-communism. ==Early life and family== His mother was of German ancestry; his father was of Slovak ancestry. Voight is the middle of three brothers: volcanologist Barry Voight was born in 1937; musician Chip Taylor was born in 1940. Voight's son James Haven and daughter Angelina Jolie are actors. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1938 births Category:Living people Category:American Academy Award winning actors Category:Actors from New York (state) Category:BAFTA Award winning actors Category:Movie producers from New York (state) Category:Screenwriters from New York (state) Category:People from Yonkers, New York Category:American movie actors Category:American stage actors Category:American television actors Category:Republicans (United States) Category:Golden Globe Award winning actors Category:Anti-communists
title: Jon Voight
